DOMRectList.summary: The DOMRectList interface represents a collection of objects, typically used to hold the rectangles associated with a particular element, like bounding boxes returned by methods such as . It provides access to each rectangle in the list via its index, along with a length property that indicates the total number of rectangles in the list.

blockquote.para: DOMRectList exists for compatibility with legacy Web content and is not recommended to be used when creating new APIs.

DOMRectListItem.summary:
The method
item() returns the at the specified index within the list, or null if the index is out of range.
DOMRectListItem.returns: A object at the specified index in the DOMRectList, or null if index is greater than or equal to the number of rectangles in the list.

DOMRectListLength.summary: The read-only length property of the interface returns the number of objects in the list.
DOMRectListLength.value: A positive integer representing the count of DOMRect objects in the DOMRectList. If there are no rectangles in the list, length is 0.
